title: Constructivist Instructional Design for Fitness Knowledge Learning: Applying Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Learners consist of elementary education teachers and physical education job seekers. Operates a real-time feedback system using personal smart devices (BYOD). Enables physical activity data collection and visualization in laboratory settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain the interaction between aerobic/anaerobic metabolic systems by linking them to three energy pathways (ATP-PCr, anaerobic glycolysis, aerobic system).
Learners can derive an individual’s optimal exercise zone with 80% accuracy by analyzing heart rate and exercise intensity data.
Learners can create instructional materials for elementary students by restructuring complex physiological concepts into step-by-step visualizations (concept maps, flowcharts).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
